result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon M. Aide was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Remit fines and costs, with the exception of the DNA surcharge--to be taken from bond on deposit

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.

Absolute sobriety- no alcohol, illegal drugs, or controlled substances without a valid prescription, taken only as prescribed and as approved by agent.
No entrance into any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Undergo assessments, treatments, and counseling as recommended by agent

timeConds.notes: Community service as determined by agent

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon M. Aide

Defendant Brandon M. Aide in court with attorney Kevin D. Musolf.  Defendant Brandon M. Aide in custody.  Allen R Brey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:01pm
Court has copy of alternative PSI
DA spks on sentencing
Atty Musolf spks on sentencing
Def addresses the court
DA requests bond be forfeited for conduct in 16CF134
Court imposes:
Imposed and stayed: 18 months initial confinement, 24 months extended supervision. Consecutive to 15CF59. Eligible for CIP & SAP.
3 years probation:
Remit fines and costs, with exception of DNA surcharge-take from bond on deposit
Absolute sobriety- no alcohol, illegal drugs, or controlled substances without a valid prescription and taken only as prescribed and as approved by agent.  Undergo assessments, treatments, and counseling as recommended by agent  
No entrance into any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  
Community service as determined by agent
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.

Atty Musolf spks on bond forfeiture
Court will not forfeit bail
Def remains in custody
Appeal rights
